t: Psalm 103
Of David.
Praise*pn the Lord,*s my soul; all*ld my inmost being, praise his holy name.
Praise*ln the Lord,*s my soul, and*ld forget not all his benefits—
who*ln forgives all your sins and*ld heals all your diseases,
who*ln redeems your life from the pit and*ld crowns you with love and compassion,
who*ln satisfies your desires with good things so*ld that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
The*pn Lord*s works righteousness and*ld justice for all the oppressed.
He*pn made known his ways to Moses, his*ld deeds to the people of Israel:
The*ln Lord*s is compassionate and gracious, slow*ld to anger, abounding in love.
He*ln will not always accuse, nor*ld will he harbor his anger forever;
he*ln does not treat us as our sins deserve or*ld repay us according to our iniquities.
For*ln as high as the heavens are above the earth, so*ld great is his love for those who fear him;
as*ln far as the east is from the west, so*ld far has he removed our transgressions from us.
As*pn a father has compassion on his children, so*ld the Lord*s has compassion on those who fear him;
for*ln he knows how we are formed, he*ld remembers that we are dust.
The*ln life of mortals is like grass, they*ld flourish like a flower of the field;
the*ln wind blows over it and it is gone, and*ld its place remembers it no more.
But*ln from everlasting to everlasting the*ld Lord’s*s love is with those who fear him, and*ld his righteousness with their children’s children—
with*ln those who keep his covenant and*ld remember to obey his precepts.
The*pn Lord*s has established his throne in heaven, and*ld his kingdom rules over all.
Praise*pn the Lord,*s you his angels, you*ld mighty ones who do his bidding, who*ld obey his word.
Praise*ln the Lord,*s all his heavenly hosts, you*ld his servants who do his will.
Praise*ln the Lord,*s all his works everywhere*ld in his dominion. Praise*pn the Lord,*s my soul.
